alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 7:24AM CDT until April 05 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Jasper County in east central Mississippi... Jones County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 830 AM CDT. * At 724 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Taylorsville to near Carson, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Stringer and Bay Springs around 735 AM CDT. Turnerville and Moss around 740 AM CDT. Vernon around 745 AM CDT. Paulding and Moselle around 750 AM CDT. Ellisville, Heidelberg and Stafford Springs around 755 AM CDT. Laurel around 800 AM CDT. Tuckers Crossing around 805 AM CDT. Mill Creek around 815 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Soso. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for central, southeastern and east central Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
